definitions: capable of being spoken to, communicated with, or approached directly
able to be accessed through a specific address or location identifier
examples: The CEO made herself addressable to all employees during office hours
These concerns are addressable through proper training and support
Each device on the network has an addressable memory location
The addressable market for this product includes millions of potential customers

definitions: having been directed in speech or writing to a specific person or group
having been dealt with, handled, or given attention to resolve
examples: The letter was addressed to the company president
She felt honored when the speaker addressed her directly
All safety concerns were addressed before construction began
The addressed issues no longer posed problems for the team

definitions: very skilled or proficient at something through practice and natural ability
examples: She's adept at solving complex mathematical problems
The chef was adept with a knife, cutting vegetables precisely
He became adept at reading people's emotions through experience
The company hired consultants adept in digital transformation

definitions: sticking fast to a surface or object through physical attachment
devoted to or supporting a particular belief, cause, or leader
examples: The adherent coating protected the metal from rust
Remove any adherent tissue before applying the bandage
He was an adherent follower of the philosophical movement
The party's adherent members rallied behind their candidate

definitions: able to stick fast to a surface or object through natural or chemical properties
examples: The adhesive tape held the package securely closed
This adhesive bandage will protect your wound while healing
The adhesive properties of the glue make it perfect for crafts
Choose an adhesive surface for better grip during exercise

definitions: next to or adjoining something else, sharing a border or being very close
examples: The hotel is adjacent to the shopping mall
Our offices occupy adjacent buildings on the same street
The adjacent rooms share a connecting door for convenience
Plant tomatoes in beds adjacent to herbs for better growth

definitions: of, relating to, or functioning as an adjective in grammar or language
examples: The adjectival phrase modifies the noun in this sentence
Students learned to identify adjectival clauses in complex sentences
Her adjectival use of nouns created vivid descriptions
The word has both adjectival and adverbial functions

definitions: relating to or functioning as a word that modifies or describes a noun
added to something else as supplementary rather than essential
examples: The adjective form of the word describes qualities
Use more adjective phrases to make your writing descriptive
These are merely adjective considerations to the main argument
The committee serves in an adjective capacity to the board

definitions: added or attached to something but not an essential part of it
connected or added to an organization in a temporary or subordinate capacity
examples: She teaches as an adjunct professor at the university
The research center operates as an adjunct facility
The adjunct committee provides advisory support when needed
He serves in an adjunct role to the main team

definitions: capable of being adjusted, altered, or adapted to fit different needs or conditions
examples: The adjustable desk height accommodates users of different sizes
This chair has adjustable armrests for maximum comfort
Interest rates on adjustable mortgages change with market conditions
The adjustable settings allow you to customize your experience

definitions: changed or modified to achieve a desired fit, appearance, or result
adapted successfully to conditions or circumstances, especially psychologically
examples: The adjusted figures account for inflation over time
She wore her adjusted uniform after the alterations
He's well adjusted despite his difficult childhood experiences
The adjusted student thrived in her new school environment

definitions: deserving respect and approval for excellence, achievement, or positive qualities
examples: Her admirable dedication to charity work inspired others
The team showed admirable courage in difficult circumstances
His admirable honesty earned him everyone's trust and respect
The architect created an admirable blend of form and function

definitions: regarded with respect, approval, or warm appreciation for qualities or achievements
looked at with pleasure, wonder, or satisfaction for beauty or excellence
examples: The admired leader inspired loyalty among her followers
He was an admired figure in the scientific community
She admired paintings filled the gallery with interested visitors
The admired garden attracted photographers from around the region

definitions: acceptable or valid, especially as evidence in a court of law
having the right to be admitted or allowed entry to a place
examples: The judge ruled the evidence admissible in court
Only admissible documents will be considered for the application
Students with admissible test scores can enroll immediately
The admissible age for this program is eighteen years

definitions: legally taken and raised as one's own child from other parents
taken up, chosen, or approved as one's own idea, method, or practice
examples: Their adopted daughter brought joy to the entire family
Adopted children have the same legal rights as biological ones
The company adopted new policies to improve efficiency
The adopted resolution passed with unanimous support

definitions: related through adoption rather than birth, especially referring to parents or family
examples: Her adoptive parents raised her with love and care
The adoptive family welcomed their new son warmly
Adoptive mothers face unique challenges and rewards
He searched for his birth parents while loving his adoptive ones

definitions: inspiring great affection or delight through being charming, attractive, or endearing
examples: The adorable puppy melted everyone's hearts at the shelter
She wore an adorable dress to her birthday party
His adorable dimples appeared whenever he smiled
The children put on an adorable performance for parents

definitions: loved deeply and tenderly with great affection and devotion
regarded with deep, often rapturous love, worship, or reverence
examples: The adored grandmother was the heart of the family
His adored wife supported him through every challenge
The adored celebrity couldn't go anywhere without fans following
Ancient peoples built temples to their adored deities

definitions: feeling or showing deep love, devotion, and admiration for someone or something
examples: Her adoring fans waited hours to meet her
He gazed at his newborn with adoring eyes
The adoring crowd cheered as their team won
She received adoring letters from admirers worldwide

definitions: made more beautiful or attractive by decorating with ornaments or embellishments
examples: The adorned Christmas tree sparkled with lights and ornaments
Her adorned hair featured flowers for the wedding
The adorned palace walls displayed priceless works of art
Ancient warriors wore adorned helmets to show their rank

definitions: floating without being moored or steered, carried by water or air currents
without purpose, guidance, or support in life, feeling lost or disconnected
examples: The boat was found adrift miles from shore
Debris floated adrift after the storm passed
He felt adrift after losing his job unexpectedly
Young graduates often feel adrift in the job market

definitions: clever or skillful in using hands or mind with dexterity and resourcefulness
examples: The adroit surgeon completed the delicate operation successfully
Her adroit handling of the crisis prevented major damage
An adroit negotiator can find solutions where others see deadlock
His adroit wordplay made the speech both informative and entertaining

definitions: made poorer in quality by adding inferior or foreign substances
corrupted, debased, or made inferior by introducing improper elements
examples: The adulterated milk contained harmful chemicals
Inspectors found adulterated products in the warehouse
His adulterated version of events confused the investigation
The adulterated data led to incorrect conclusions

definitions: involving or characterized by adultery or voluntary sexual intercourse outside marriage
examples: The adulterous affair destroyed their marriage
She discovered her husband's adulterous relationship
The novel explored the consequences of adulterous behavior
Historical records revealed the king's adulterous liaisons

definitions: moving forward in space or time, approaching or coming closer
making progress or developing, especially in rank, knowledge, or achievement
examples: The advancing army forced villagers to evacuate
We watched the advancing storm clouds with concern
Her advancing career required relocating to headquarters
The advancing technology revolutionized communication methods

definitions: providing an advantage, benefit, or favorable position in achieving success or desired results
examples: The hilltop location was advantageous for defense
Learning multiple languages is advantageous in global business
They negotiated an advantageous contract with suppliers
Early investment proved advantageous when stocks soared

definitions: happening or carried on according to chance rather than design or planning
appearing in an unusual or abnormal place, especially in botanical or medical contexts
examples: Their adventitious meeting at the airport changed both lives
The researcher noted several adventitious findings during experiments
The plant developed adventitious roots along its stem
Adventitious sounds in the lungs indicated possible infection

definitions: willing to take risks or try new and potentially difficult experiences
full of excitement, danger, or unusual experiences that test one's abilities
examples: The adventurous travelers explored remote mountain villages
She has an adventurous spirit that loves challenges
They planned an adventurous expedition to Antarctica
His adventurous cooking combines unexpected flavors

definitions: of, relating to, or functioning as an adverb or adverbial phrase in grammar
examples: The adverbial clause modifies the main verb
Students identified adverbial elements in each sentence
Her adverbial use of adjectives created dynamic prose
The phrase serves an adverbial function here

definitions: preventing success or development by being harmful, unfavorable, or creating difficulties
examples: Adverse weather conditions delayed the construction project
The medication can have adverse effects in some patients
The company faced adverse publicity after the scandal
Despite adverse circumstances, she completed her degree

definitions: publicly announced or promoted through paid media to attract attention or patronage
made widely known or brought to public attention through various means
examples: The advertised sale attracted hundreds of shoppers
The job was advertised in major newspapers nationwide
Their advertised commitment to quality attracted new clients
The advertised benefits of the program proved accurate

definitions: worthy of being recommended or suggested as wise, prudent, or beneficial to do
examples: It's advisable to book flights early for better prices
Wearing sunscreen daily is advisable for skin health
The lawyer said settling was advisable given the circumstances
Taking vitamins may be advisable during winter months

definitions: given guidance, recommendations, or counsel about what should be done
having been informed or notified about something officially or formally
examples: The doctor advised rest was essential for recovery
Students were advised to submit applications early
Please be advised that the office closes early today
All residents were advised of the emergency procedures

definitions: having the power or function to give advice or make recommendations
serving as a warning or recommendation but not requiring compliance
examples: The advisory board meets quarterly to guide strategy
She serves in an advisory capacity to the CEO
The weather service issued an advisory for small boats
Travel advisory warnings help tourists stay safe abroad

definitions: supplied with air or exposed to circulation of air for freshness
made lighter by having air incorporated, creating a foamy or bubbly texture
examples: The aerated soil promoted healthy root growth
Fish thrive in properly aerated aquarium water
The aerated chocolate had a light, bubbly texture
Aerated drinks contain dissolved carbon dioxide

definitions: existing, happening, or operating in the air or from aircraft
consisting of, typical of, or relating to the air or atmosphere
examples: The aerial photograph showed the entire coastline
Aerial acrobats performed breathtaking stunts
Birds are aerial creatures adapted for flight
The aerial roots of orchids absorb moisture from air

definitions: relating to or requiring free oxygen for life and biological processes
relating to exercise that improves cardiovascular efficiency and oxygen consumption
examples: Aerobic bacteria need oxygen to survive and reproduce
Plants undergo aerobic respiration during the night
Regular aerobic exercise strengthens your heart and lungs
She teaches aerobic dance classes at the gym

definitions: designed or shaped to reduce air resistance and move efficiently through air
examples: The car's aerodynamic design improves fuel efficiency
Racing bicycles have aerodynamic frames and components
The aerodynamic shape of bird wings enables efficient flight
Engineers tested the aerodynamic properties in wind tunnels

definitions: of or relating to the science, design, and operation of aircraft and flight
examples: The aeronautic engineer designed innovative wing structures
Students studied aeronautic principles in flight school
The museum displays aeronautic achievements throughout history
Her aeronautic knowledge helped solve the technical problem

definitions: of or relating to aeronautics, the science and practice of flight and aircraft
examples: She earned her aeronautical engineering degree with honors
The aeronautical charts showed restricted airspace zones
Aeronautical innovations have made flying safer than ever
The conference focused on aeronautical safety standards

definitions: concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty in art and nature
relating to a particular style, artistic sensibility, or principles of taste
examples: The building's aesthetic appeal attracts many photographers
She made aesthetic choices that enhanced the room's ambiance
His aesthetic sense influenced all his design decisions
The brand developed a minimalist aesthetic for their products

definitions: friendly, good-natured, and easy to talk to in a warm, pleasant manner
examples: The affable host made everyone feel welcome immediately
His affable personality helped him excel in sales
Despite her success, she remained affable and approachable
The affable conversation made the long flight enjoyable

definitions: influenced, changed, or impacted by an external factor or condition
artificial and designed to impress, not natural or genuine in manner
examples: The affected areas received emergency aid immediately
Everyone was deeply affected by the tragic news
Her affected accent fooled no one at the party
He spoke in an affected manner to seem sophisticated

definitions: producing strong emotions, especially sadness, sympathy, or compassion in others
examples: The affecting story brought tears to many eyes
She delivered an affecting speech about overcoming adversity
The documentary's affecting scenes stayed with viewers long after
His affecting performance earned a standing ovation

definitions: readily showing warmth, fondness, or tender feelings toward others through actions or words
examples: The affectionate couple held hands throughout dinner
She's very affectionate with her grandchildren
Their affectionate cat always wants to cuddle
He wrote affectionate letters to his family overseas

definitions: relating to moods, feelings, and emotional states in psychology
having the power to influence or arouse emotions and feelings
examples: The therapist addressed both cognitive and affective issues
Affective disorders include depression and anxiety
Music has strong affective power over human emotions
The affective component of learning enhances memory retention

definitions: officially attached, connected, or associated with a larger organization or group
examples: The hospital is affiliated with the medical school
All affiliated members receive monthly newsletters
She works for a company affiliated with the university
The affiliated branches operate under corporate guidelines

definitions: expressing agreement, consent, or acceptance rather than negation or refusal
supporting, encouraging, or expressing positive confirmation of something
examples: She gave an affirmative nod to the proposal
The vote resulted in an affirmative decision
The company takes affirmative action to ensure diversity
His affirmative response encouraged us to proceed

definitions: attached, fastened, or joined to something else, especially in a permanent way
examples: The label was firmly affixed to the package
A plaque was affixed to the monument's base
The stamp must be affixed before mailing the letter
Warning signs were affixed to all dangerous equipment

definitions: suffering from or affected by something harmful, especially illness or misfortune
examples: The afflicted patients received specialized medical care
Communities afflicted by drought need immediate assistance
He was afflicted with chronic pain for years
The afflicted region struggled to recover from flooding
